title: How to Make Cinnamon Raisin Bread

methods.name: Gathering the Ingredients for Cinnamon Raisin Bread

steps.headline: Get 1 cup (6 oz.)
steps.description: of raisins. These should soak in warm water before you use them in order to get them plump, so put them in a small bowl and cover them in water while you look for the other things you will need for cinnamon raisin bread.

steps.headline: Measure 1 cup (8 oz.)
steps.description: of whole milk. You can use 2 percent milk if you want to reduce the fat and calories in your bread.

steps.headline: Melt 1/4 cup (2 oz.)
steps.description: of salted butter. If you prefer to use unsalted butter, that is fine, but if you do that, add 2 tsp. of salt to your flour.

steps.headline: Measure 6 cups (48 oz.)
steps.description: of flour and 1/2 cup (4 oz.) of white sugar.

steps.headline: Set aside 1 tbsp.
steps.description: (0.5 oz.) of dry active yeast and 2 tbsp. of cinnamon.

steps.headline: Purchase the ingredients that you do not have at home already at your local grocery store.
steps.description: Most things can be found in the baking aisle or refrigerated section.

methods.name: Mixing and Baking Your Cinnamon Raisin Bread

steps.headline: Pour a cup of water into a large mixing bowl and add the yeast.
steps.description: Stir the yeast into the water until it is fully dissolved.

steps.headline: Add the milk and the melted butter to the water, slowly stirring everything together.
Add all but 1/2 cup (4 oz.)
steps.description: of the flour to the mixture. If you use a hand mixer, put it on low speed to knead the ingredients into a dough. For best results, knead by hand until you have a smooth, sticky dough. Knead for about 10 minutes. You will know it is ready when the dough can form a ball, or when it springs back into place when you poke it with your finger.

steps.headline: Incorporate the raisins into the dough.
steps.description: If they are still moist, add a bit more flour to absorb that moisture.

steps.headline: Place the dough in a bowl and cover it.
steps.description: Leave it to raise for about an hour. While you are waiting for the dough to rise, you can combine the sugar and cinnamon.

steps.headline: Cut the dough into 2 equal pieces.
steps.description: This recipe makes two loaves of cinnamon raisin bread. Roll each piece out on your counter or cutting board.

steps.headline: Dip a brush into the egg and water and brush each side of the dough with the egg.
Sprinkle the dough with the cinnamon and sugar mixture until it is all used up.
Roll up the dough and pinch the seam (the place where the end of the dough is incorporated into the full roll).
Put the loaves in a pan, with the seam facing down.
steps.description: Leave the loaves to finish rising. This should take about 40 minutes.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190.5 Celsius).
Bake the cinnamon raisin loaves for 30 to 40 minutes, until they begin to brown on the outside.

text: Gathering the Ingredients for Cinnamon Raisin Bread Get 1 cup (6 oz.) of raisins. These should soak in warm water before you use them in order to get them plump, so put them in a small bowl and cover them in water while you look for the other things you will need for cinnamon raisin bread. Measure 1 cup (8 oz.) of whole milk. You can use 2 percent milk if you want to reduce the fat and calories in your bread. Melt 1/4 cup (2 oz.) of salted butter. If you prefer to use unsalted butter, that is fine, but if you do that, add 2 tsp. of salt to your flour. Measure 6 cups (48 oz.) of flour and 1/2 cup (4 oz.) of white sugar. Set aside 1 tbsp. (0.5 oz.) of dry active yeast and 2 tbsp. of cinnamon. Beat an egg with 2 tsp. (9.85 mL) of water. Purchase the ingredients that you do not have at home already at your local grocery store. Most things can be found in the baking aisle or refrigerated section. Mixing and Baking Your Cinnamon Raisin Bread Pour a cup of water into a large mixing bowl and add the yeast. Stir the yeast into the water until it is fully dissolved. Add the milk and the melted butter to the water, slowly stirring everything together.  Add all but 1/2 cup (4 oz.) of the flour to the mixture. If you use a hand mixer, put it on low speed to knead the ingredients into a dough. For best results, knead by hand until you have a smooth, sticky dough. Knead for about 10 minutes. You will know it is ready when the dough can form a ball, or when it springs back into place when you poke it with your finger. Incorporate the raisins into the dough. If they are still moist, add a bit more flour to absorb that moisture. Place the dough in a bowl and cover it. Leave it to raise for about an hour. While you are waiting for the dough to rise, you can combine the sugar and cinnamon. Cut the dough into 2 equal pieces. This recipe makes two loaves of cinnamon raisin bread. Roll each piece out on your counter or cutting board. Dip a brush into the egg and water and brush each side of the dough with the egg.  Sprinkle the dough with the cinnamon and sugar mixture until it is all used up.  Roll up the dough and pinch the seam (the place where the end of the dough is incorporated into the full roll).  Put the loaves in a pan, with the seam facing down. Leave the loaves to finish rising. This should take about 40 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit (190.5 Celsius).  Bake the cinnamon raisin loaves for 30 to 40 minutes, until they begin to brown on the outside.
